column4: anyone know why some windows arent themed in XFCE (like brasero for example)
perhaps its using gtk3? you should avoid brasero and use xfburn... seriously.
xfburn doesnt work for me
just spins my disk really loudly and doesnt ever stop
i prefer gnome programs Artemis
thunar isnt bad
your call, my experience with brasero has been the complete opposite.
brasero is extremely stable for me
rarely ever fails
xfburn sounded like it was gonna burn up my disk drive
gnome-baker is good too

should be a problem with wodim, after all xfburn is a simple front end, much like gnomebaker used to be. brasero on the other hand... takes over the drive, if brasero ever crashes, goodbye to burning (or reading) until restart, that was my experience with it. Oh, and doesn't play along with k3b either
so how do i change the gtk theme from xfce? i want brasero and nautilus to look the same as everything else
i hate k3b
and all things KDE
KDE is the worst thing to happen to linux since unity
even though KDE was first
in Appearances you change the gtk2 theme...
doesnt work for me
it doesnt effect the gtk apps when im using xfce
it did in ubuntu 11.04
ever since unity became part of ubuntu, upgrades have been hell
all kinds of stuff messes up and stops working
are you sure its not only a few apps like you said? is leafpad and friends not changing appeareance?
